title: The Devoted Friend
author: Oscar Wilde
summary: Hans, a poor gardener, is exploited by his wealthy friend, the miller. The miller repeatedly asks Hans for help, pretending to be devoted, but never reciprocates. Hans ultimately sacrifices himself for his friends sake, highlighting the hypocrisy of false friendship.

title: The Happy Prince
author: Oscar Wilde
summary: A golden statue of a prince overlooks a city and sees the suffering of its poor. With the help of a kind-hearted swallow, the prince gives away all his gold and jewels to help the needy, ultimately sacrificing himself for the welfare of others.

title: The Night And The Rose.
author: Oscar Wilde
summary: A student loves a girl but needs a red rose to win her heart. A nightingale sacrifices her life to create the rose by singing all night with her heart against a thorn. In the end, the girl rejects the rose, highlighting the tragedy of unappreciated sacrifice.

title: The Remarkable Rocket.
author: Oscar Wilde
summary: A vain and pompous firework, the Rocket, believes himself destined for greatness. On the night of a royal wedding, he fails spectacularly because of his arrogance. The story humorously critiques pride and self-importance.

title: The Selfish Giant
author: Oscar Wilde
summary: A giant builds a wall around his garden to keep children out, causing eternal winter in his garden. When he eventually allows the children in, spring returns. He learns the joy of generosity and love before he dies.

title: The Clockmaker’s Promise
author: Ai generated
summary: In a quiet village, an old clockmaker works for fifty years to repair clocks and fulfill a promise to his late wife, finding healing through helping a young girl.

title: At the Bay
author: Katherine Mansfield
summary: Depicts a day in the life of the Burnell family, exploring the nuances of family relationships, childhood, and domestic life.

title: The Garden-Party
author: Katherine Mansfield
summary: Laura Burnell wrestles with class consciousness and mortality when a working-class neighbor dies during her family`s garden party.

title: The Daughters of the Late Colonel
author: Katherine Mansfield
summary: Focuses on the lives of two sisters who struggle with freedom and indecision after their father`s death.

summary: An adventurous tale of crime and cunning in Corsica, blending suspense with Maupassant’s realism.

title: The Grave
author: Guy de Maupassant
summary: A chilling story of death and superstition, examining human fear and the eerie power of graves and memory.

title: The Magic Couch
author: Guy de Maupassant
summary: A short tale where a supernatural couch brings unexpected experiences, blending whimsy with the uncanny.

title: Clochette
author: Guy de Maupassant
summary: A touching tale about friendship and loss, centered on the character of Clochette, whose life is marked by both hardship and resilience.

title: The Kiss
author: Guy de Maupassant
summary: A subtle examination of desire and social convention through a simple but significant kiss exchanged between two characters.

title: The Legion of Honor
author: Guy de Maupassant
summary: A satirical look at ambition and pride as a man’s life revolves around his hopes of receiving a prestigious honor.

title: The Test
author: Guy de Maupassant
summary: A narrative involving moral choices and loyalty, where characters face situations that reveal their true nature.

title: Found On a Drowned Man
author: Guy de Maupassant
summary: A moving discovery of personal history through objects found on a drowned stranger, exposing the loneliness and anonymity of death.

title: The Orphan
author: Guy de Maupassant
summary: An exploration of grief and innocence as it follows a young orphan's emotional struggles after losing her parents.

title: The Beggar
author: Guy de Maupassant
summary: This story reveals society’s cold indifference through the eyes of a destitute beggar, underscoring themes of poverty and perception.

title: The Rabbit
author: Guy de Maupassant
summary: A darkly humorous narrative about a couple whose relationship is tested by a trivial dispute over a rabbit.

title: His Avenger
author: Guy de Maupassant
summary: A tale of vengeance and justice as a character sets out to defend family honor after a perceived wrong.

title: My Uncle Jules
author: Guy de Maupassant
summary: A family drama driven by hopes and disappointments as the protagonist awaits the return of the elusive Uncle Jules.

title: The Model
author: Guy de Maupassant
summary: Examines the complex relationship between an artist and his model, blending themes of passion, exploitation, and regret.

title: A Vagabond
author: Guy de Maupassant
summary: The wandering life of a vagabond is depicted, revealing the tension between freedom and societal alienation.

title: The Fishing Hole
author: Guy de Maupassant
summary: Combines humor and human nature in a tale of competition and pride near a rural fishing spot.

title: The Spasm
author: Guy de Maupassant
summary: A brief but powerful narrative grappling with grief and the uncontrollable power of memory.

title: In the Wood
author: Guy de Maupassant
summary: Blending atmosphere and suspense, this story centers on an unsettling moment experienced in a dark wood.

title: Martine
author: Guy de Maupassant
summary: A study of rural hardship and emotional endurance through the life of the character Martine.

title: All Over
author: Guy de Maupassant
summary: A sharp, ironic glimpse into fleeting disappointment when plans and hopes are dashed suddenly.

title: The Parrot
author: Guy de Maupassant
summary: Unfolds the chaos and misunderstandings brought about by a mischievous parrot in a small town.

title: The Piece of String
author: Guy de Maupassant
summary: A powerful parable about suspicion and reputation, as a man’s simple action spirals into public accusation.

title: The Golden Bird
author: Brothers Grimm
summary: A classic tale about a prince’s quest to catch a golden bird and the trials he faces, filled with magical helpers and jealous brothers.

title: Hans in Luck
author: Brothers Grimm
summary: Hans is rewarded for his service by exchanging his possessions until he ends up with nothing, yet remains cheerful, seeing good in every trade.

title: Jorinda and Jorindel
author: Brothers Grimm
summary: Jorinda is captured by a witch and her beloved Jorindel must undertake a magical quest to save her.

title: The Travelling Musicians
author: Brothers Grimm
summary: Four aging domestic animals become musicians and outwit robbers at a cottage, becoming the famous Bremen Town Musicians.

title: Old Sultan
author: Brothers Grimm
summary: An old dog named Sultan proves his worth and loyalty by protecting his family from a wolf, earning a renewed place in his master's home.

title: The Straw, the Coal, and the Bean
author: Brothers Grimm
summary: A playful adventure of a straw, a coal, and a bean that encounter obstacles together with humorous results.

title: Briar Rose
author: Brothers Grimm
summary: Also known as Sleeping Beauty, this tale follows a princess cursed to sleep for a hundred years until awakened by a prince.

title: The Dog and the Sparrow
author: Brothers Grimm
summary: A mistreated dog finds a friend in a sparrow, who exacts vengeance on the dog's cruel master with clever tricks.

title: The Twelve Dancing Princesses
author: Brothers Grimm
summary: Twelve princesses secretly dance every night, baffling the king who offers their hand in marriage to anyone who can solve the mystery.

title: The Fisherman and His Wife
author: Brothers Grimm
summary: A fisherman’s greedy wife pushes him to keep asking a magical fish for more, until their desires bring ruin.

title: The Willow-Wren and the Bear
author: Brothers Grimm
summary: A conflict between birds and the bear leads to a clever victory for the smallest creatures.

title: The Frog-Prince
author: Brothers Grimm
summary: A princess promises her friendship to a frog, who is then revealed to be an enchanted prince.

title: Cat and Mouse in Partnership
author: Brothers Grimm
summary: A cat and a mouse become partners, but their relationship ends in betrayal and tragedy.

title: The Goose-Girl
author: Brothers Grimm
summary: A princess is forced to become a goose-girl, but with help, she is restored to her true status.

title: The Adventures of Chanticleer and Partlet
author: Brothers Grimm
summary: Chanticleer the rooster and Partlet the hen experience a series of humorous, sometimes cautionary mishaps.

title: Rapunzel
author: Brothers Grimm
summary: A maiden trapped in a tower by a wicked sorceress is finally freed by a prince.

title: Fundevogel
author: Brothers Grimm
summary: Two foster siblings, Fundevogel and Lenchen, escape from harm using magical transformations.

title: The Valiant Little Tailor
author: Brothers Grimm
summary: A clever tailor triumphs over giants and other obstacles by wit and courage, making his fortune.

title: Hansel and Gretel
author: Brothers Grimm
summary: Two siblings outwit a witch who tries to eat them after being abandoned in the forest.

title: The Mouse, the Bird, and the Sausage
author: Brothers Grimm
summary: Three friends find their harmonious life disrupted by trying to change their roles, leading to disaster.

title: Mother Holle
author: Brothers Grimm
summary: A hardworking girl is rewarded and her lazy stepsister punished by the magical Mother Holle.

title: Little Red-Cap (Little Red Riding Hood)
author: Brothers Grimm
summary: A young girl is saved from a wolf’s belly by a brave hunter after visiting her grandmother.

title: The Robber Bridegroom
author: Brothers Grimm
summary: A bride discovers her betrothed is a murderer and cleverly exposes him, saving her own life.

title: Tom Thumb
author: Brothers Grimm
summary: A child no bigger than a thumb uses his cleverness to escape trouble and help his family.

title: Rumpelstiltskin
author: Brothers Grimm
summary: A miller's daughter must discover the true name of a magical dwarf to save her child.

title: Clever Gretel
author: Brothers Grimm
summary: Clever Gretel outsmarts her employer and steals two chickens prepared for guests.

title: The Old Man and His Grandson
author: Brothers Grimm
summary: A child teaches a lesson in kindness to his parents when they mistreat his aging grandfather.

title: The Little Peasant
author: Brothers Grimm
summary: A clever peasant uses his wits to gain wealth and outsmart those who snubbed him.

title: Frederick and Catherine
author: Brothers Grimm
summary: Frederick’s foolish wife, Catherine, makes one blunder after another to Frederick’s exasperation.

title: Sweetheart Roland
author: Brothers Grimm
summary: A girl and her beloved, Roland, elude a wicked witch with magical disguises and perseverance.

title: Snowdrop
author: Brothers Grimm
summary: The story of Snow White, who escapes her jealous stepmother and finds refuge with seven dwarfs.

title: The Pink
author: Brothers Grimm
summary: A prince, born from a wish for a child, is protected by a magical flower from his wicked mother.

title: Clever Elsie
author: Brothers Grimm
summary: Elsie's excessive worrying leads to comic misadventures about her own wedding dinner.

title: The Miser in the Bush
author: Brothers Grimm
summary: A miser is punished for his misdeeds by magic creatures after cheating a servant.

title: Ashputtel
author: Brothers Grimm
summary: The classic Cinderella story: a mistreated girl's fortune turns when she attends the royal ball with magical help.

title: The White Snake
author: Brothers Grimm
summary: A servant gains the ability to understand animals after tasting a white snake and uses it to perform heroic deeds.

title: The Wolf and the Seven Little Kids
author: Brothers Grimm
summary: A wolf tries to eat seven young goats, but the youngest outwits him and saves them all.

title: The Queen Bee
author: Brothers Grimm
summary: A kind prince is rewarded for his empathy towards animals when they help him pass the tests to win a princess.

title: The Elves and the Shoemaker
author: Brothers Grimm
summary: Elves secretly help a poor shoemaker finish shoes at night, changing his fortune.

title: The Juniper-Tree
author: Brothers Grimm
summary: A boy, murdered by his stepmother, is magically resurrected to deliver justice for the wrongs done to him.

title: The Turnip
author: Brothers Grimm
summary: Two brothers’ fortunes change after one discovers a giant turnip, teaching a lesson about envy and generosity.

title: Clever Hans
author: Brothers Grimm
summary: Hans misinterprets advice and instructions, causing amusing outcomes.

title: The Three Languages
author: Brothers Grimm
summary: A youth, considered foolish, learns animal languages and uses this gift to become king.

title: The Fox and the Cat
author: Brothers Grimm
summary: A fox who knows many tricks is outwitted by a cat who knows only one, but it saves him.

title: The Four Clever Brothers
author: Brothers Grimm
summary: Four brothers learn different trades and combine skills to save a princess.

title: Lily and the Lion
author: Brothers Grimm
summary: A maiden promises to marry a lion transformed into a man and embarks on a quest to rescue him.

title: The Fox and the Horse
author: Brothers Grimm
summary: A horse, cast out by his master, outwits him with the help of a clever fox.

title: The Blue Light
author: Brothers Grimm
summary: A discharged soldier uses a magical blue light to take revenge on a king who wronged him.

title: The Raven
author: Brothers Grimm
summary: A prince undertakes a quest to rescue a princess transformed into a raven.

title: The Golden Goose
author: Brothers Grimm
summary: A simpleton’s kindness is rewarded with a magical goose and a string of followers.

title: The Water of Life
author: Brothers Grimm
summary: Three brothers compete to find magical water to cure their dying father; the youngest succeeds through kindness.

title: The Twelve Huntsmen
author: Brothers Grimm
summary: A woman and eleven companions dress as huntsmen to save her engagement to a prince.

title: The King of the Golden Mountain
author: Brothers Grimm
summary: A young man overcomes many perils to become king and win his family's happiness.

title: Doctor Knowall
author: Brothers Grimm
summary: A peasant accidentally becomes a famous doctor, solving crimes by luck and misunderstanding.

title: The Seven Ravens
author: Brothers Grimm
summary: A girl sets out to rescue her brothers who are transformed into ravens due to a curse.

title: The Wedding of Mrs Fox
author: Brothers Grimm
summary: Mrs. Fox tests suitors' loyalty after Mr. Fox fakes his own death.

title: The Salad
author: Brothers Grimm
summary: A magical salad brings misfortune and confusion, but luck ultimately prevails.

title: The Story of the Youth Who Went Forth to Learn What Fear Was
author: Brothers Grimm
summary: A fearless youth goes on a quest to discover the meaning of fear, learning life lessons along the way.

title: King Grisly-Beard
author: Brothers Grimm
summary: A proud princess learns humility and the value of kindness after marrying a disguised king.

title: Iron Hans
author: Brothers Grimm
summary: A wild man helps a prince grow into a wise and brave king through adventure and magic.

title: Cat-Skin
author: Brothers Grimm
summary: A princess, pursued by her own father, escapes and hides under a coat made of many furs, ultimately finding love.

title: Snow-White and Rose-Red
author: Brothers Grimm
summary: Two sisters, Snow-White and Rose-Red, show kindness to a bear who is really an enchanted prince.

title: The Emperor's New Clothes
author: Hans Christian Andersen
summary: A vain emperor is tricked into wearing invisible clothes, exposing the dangers of pride and flattery.

title: The Swineherd
author: Hans Christian Andersen
summary: A prince disguises himself as a swineherd to win the heart of a vain princess, ultimately teaching her a lesson about superficiality.

title: The Real Princess
author: Hans Christian Andersen
summary: Also known as The Princess and the Pea, this story tells of a delicate princess proved by a single pea beneath many mattresses.

title: The Shoes of Fortune
author: Hans Christian Andersen
summary: Magical shoes bring their wearers various adventures—and often disappointment—by fulfilling their deepest wishes in unexpected ways.

title: The Fir Tree
author: Hans Christian Andersen
summary: A fir tree, discontent with the present, misses out on the joys of life by yearning only for the future.

title: The Snow Queen
author: Hans Christian Andersen
summary: A young girl embarks on a magical journey to rescue her friend from the icy clutches of the Snow Queen.

title: The Leap-Frog
author: Hans Christian Andersen
summary: Animals compete to earn the king’s favor; the frog’s wit surprises everyone despite others’ boasts.

title: The Elderbush
author: Hans Christian Andersen
summary: A tale of dreams and memories as told by the magical elderbush and a loving grandmother.

title: The Bell
author: Hans Christian Andersen
summary: Children search for a mysterious bell in the forest, discovering beauty and wonder along the way.

title: The Old House
author: Hans Christian Andersen
summary: A lonely old house finds new companionship and happiness after years of solitude.

title: The Happy Family
author: Hans Christian Andersen
summary: A family of snails contentedly live beneath a burdock leaf, reflecting simple happiness and comic irony.

title: The Story of a Mother
author: Hans Christian Andersen
summary: A mother’s deep love is tested as she braves great challenges to save her child from Death.

title: The False Collar
author: Hans Christian Andersen
summary: A discarded collar recounts its adventures, comically boasting about its brief glory.

title: The Shadow
author: Hans Christian Andersen
summary: A man's shadow takes on a life of its own, ultimately overpowering and destroying its creator.

title: The Little Match Girl
author: Hans Christian Andersen
summary: A poor girl experiences bittersweet visions in the cold before passing away, providing a poignant social commentary.

title: The Dream of Little Tuk
author: Hans Christian Andersen
summary: Little Tuk’s dreams transport him on magical journeys that bring both comfort and wisdom.

title: The Naughty Boy
author: Hans Christian Andersen
summary: Cupid, depicted as a mischievous boy, plays pranks, turning love upside down in a lighthearted tale.

title: The Red Shoes
author: Hans Christian Andersen
summary: A vain girl’s obsession with red shoes leads to a lesson in humility and repentance.

title: The Black Cat
author: Edgar Allan Poe
summary: A chilling story of guilt and psychological horror as a man's descent into madness is symbolized by a mysterious black cat.

title: The Flayed Hand
author: Guy de Maupassant
summary: A severed hand, kept as a curiosity, exacts vengeance upon those who disturb it.

title: The Vengeance of a Tree
author: Eleanor Furneaux Smith
summary: A tree appears to exact revenge from beyond the grave, raising questions of guilt and justice.

title: The Parlor-Car Ghost
author: Anonymous
summary: Passengers on a train witness spectral events, leading to fright and confusion.

title: Ghost of Buckstown Inn
author: Anonymous
summary: An eerie tale about a restless spirit haunting a rural inn.

title: The Burglar’s Ghost
author: Anonymous
summary: After a failed robbery, a burglar's ghost lingers to unsettle future occupants.

title: A Phantom Toe
author: Anonymous
summary: A comical account of a mysterious toe that haunts a small town.

title: Mrs. Davenport’s Ghost
author: Anonymous
summary: The ghost of Mrs. Davenport returns to reveal long-kept family secrets.

title: The Phantom Woman
author: Anonymous
summary: A mysterious woman appears and vanishes, leaving characters doubting their senses.

title: The Phantom Hag
author: Anonymous
summary: A terrifying hag haunts those who trespass her domain.

title: From the Tomb
author: Anonymous
summary: An unquiet spirit emerges from the grave to right past wrongs.

title: Sandy’s Ghost
author: Anonymous
summary: A loyal dog’s ghost continues to visit and protect its owner.

title: The Ghosts of Red Creek
author: Anonymous
summary: Hauntings along Red Creek frighten locals and raise old legends.

title: The Spectre Bride
author: Anonymous
summary: A bride returns from the grave to fulfill an unbreakable vow.

title: How He Caught the Ghost
author: Anonymous
summary: Through humorous missteps, a character attempts to trap a troublesome ghost.

title: Grand-Dame’s Ghost Story
author: Anonymous
summary: An elderly woman recounts a personal, haunting encounter from her youth.

title: A Fight with a Ghost
author: Anonymous
summary: A physical battle with a ghost tests one man's courage and beliefs.

title: Colonel Halifax’s Ghost Story
author: Anonymous
summary: A colonel tells of spectral events experienced during his service.

title: The Ghost of the Count
author: Anonymous
summary: A nobleman's ghost haunts his ancestral home, seeking peace.

title: The Old Mansion
author: Anonymous
summary: Mysteries abound in an old mansion where restless spirits roam.

title: A Misfit Ghost
author: Anonymous
summary: A ghost struggles to be scary but only causes laughter.

title: An Unbidden Guest
author: Anonymous
summary: A mysterious guest appears at a gathering, causing unease and suspicion.

title: The Dead Woman’s Photograph
author: Anonymous
summary: An old photograph reveals a chilling secret about a woman's death.

title: The Ghost of a Live Man
author: Anonymous
summary: Confusion and chaos follow when a man is mistaken for his own ghost.

title: The Ghost of Washington
author: Anonymous
summary: The spirit of George Washington returns, instilling wisdom and courage.

title: My Lord Bag of Rice
author: Yei Theodora Ozaki (reteller)
summary: A legendary warrior helps a dragon king and is rewarded with a magical bag of rice that brings good fortune.

title: The Tongue-Cut Sparrow
author: Yei Theodora Ozaki (reteller)
summary: An old man is kindly to a sparrow but his greedy wife suffers after mistreating it, showing the power of kindness and retribution.

title: The Story of Urashima Taro, the Fisher Lad
author: Yei Theodora Ozaki (reteller)
summary: A fisherman is transported to an undersea palace, but when he returns, centuries have passed in the world above.

title: The Farmer and the Badger
author: Yei Theodora Ozaki (reteller)
summary: A kind farmer is betrayed by a badger only for the badger to face clever retribution from a rabbit.

title: The “Shinansha,” or the South Pointing Carriage
author: Yei Theodora Ozaki (reteller)
summary: The invention of a magical carriage that always points south helps a Chinese king win battles and return home.

title: The Adventures of Kintaro, the Golden Boy
author: Yei Theodora Ozaki (reteller)
summary: Kintaro, possessed of extraordinary strength, befriends animals and has many adventures before becoming a famed warrior.

title: The Story of Princess Hase. A Story of Old Japan
author: Yei Theodora Ozaki (reteller)
summary: The virtuous Princess Hase survives many hardships through wisdom and perseverance, rewarded for her devotion and filial piety.

title: The Story of the Man Who Did Not Wish to Die
author: Yei Theodora Ozaki (reteller)
summary: A man's quest to escape death ironically teaches him the value of a finite life.

title: The Bamboo-Cutter and the Moon-Child
author: Yei Theodora Ozaki (reteller)
summary: A beautiful girl found in a bamboo stalk turns out to be a princess from the moon, returning home after many suitors are tested.

title: The Mirror of Matsuyama: A Story of Old Japan
author: Yei Theodora Ozaki (reteller)
summary: A magical mirror brings comfort and misunderstanding to a mother and daughter, teaching a lesson in love and remembrance.

title: The Goblin of Adachigahara
author: Yei Theodora Ozaki (reteller)
summary: Travelers encounter an old woman in a lonely house, who is revealed to be a terrifying goblin.

title: The Sagacious Monkey and the Boar
author: Yei Theodora Ozaki (reteller)
summary: A clever monkey outsmarts a boastful boar through trickery and intelligence.

title: The Happy Hunter and the Skillful Fisher
author: Yei Theodora Ozaki (reteller)
summary: Two royal brothers learn about humility and cooperation as they swap roles with magical help from sea gods.

title: The Story of the Old Man Who Made Withered Trees to Flower
author: Yei Theodora Ozaki (reteller)
summary: The spirit of a grateful dog helps a kind old man magically make trees blossom, punishing his greedy neighbor.

title: The Jelly Fish and the Monkey
author: Yei Theodora Ozaki (reteller)
summary: A jellyfish, tricked into a king’s dangerous mission, loses his bones and learns the cost of naiveté.

title: The Quarrel of the Monkey and the Crab
author: Yei Theodora Ozaki (reteller)
summary: The monkey’s greed and treachery are repaid with karma in this tale about justice and clever revenge.

title: The White Hare and the Crocodiles
author: Yei Theodora Ozaki (reteller)
summary: A white hare is punished for trickery, but kindness leads to its healing and happiness.

title: The Story of Prince Yamato Take
author: Yei Theodora Ozaki (reteller)
summary: The epic journeys and heroic deeds of Prince Yamato Take, one of Japan’s most famous warrior-princes.

title: Momotaro, or The Story of the Son of a Peach
author: Yei Theodora Ozaki (reteller)
summary: Born from a peach, Momotaro embarks on a quest with animal friends to defeat ogres and bring peace to his land.

title: The Ogre of Rashomon
author: Yei Theodora Ozaki (reteller)
summary: A brave warrior faces a fearsome ogre at the Rashomon gate, highlighting courage and cunning.

title: How an Old Man Lost His Wen
author: Yei Theodora Ozaki (reteller)
summary: Through a twist of fate and encounter with supernatural beings, an old man loses an unsightly bump from his face.

title: The Stones of Five Colors and the Empress Jokwa. An Old Chinese Story
author: Yei Theodora Ozaki (reteller)
summary: The Empress Jokwa repairs the broken sky with magical colored stones in this legend of balance and harmony.

title: CHARAN
author: Im Bang
summary: A celebrated story of love and devotion from 15th-century Korea. Keydong, a gifted young man, and Charan, a talented dancing girl, share an intense bond, face separation and hardship, and ultimately triumph through perseverance, intellect, and royal favor. Their journey exemplifies unwavering love and the power of destiny.

title: The Story of Chang To-Ryong
author: Im Bang
summary: Chang To-Ryong is a mysterious beggar in Seoul who is later revealed as a major Taoist spirit-man. Blending Korean folklore and Taoist beliefs, the tale explores themes of reincarnation, spirit worlds, and the kindness between a young scholar and a supernatural being.

title: A Story of the Fox
author: Im Bang
summary: A Korean official is deceived by a fox-spirit in the guise of a beautiful woman, narrowly escaping death through wisdom and good fortune. The story warns of supernatural trickery and the importance of vigilance against evil spirits.

title: Cheung Puk-Chang, the Seer
author: Im Bang
summary: Cheung Puk-Chang, revered as one of Korea’s three spirit-men, is renowned for his visions and supernatural insight. His tale describes how spiritual power and pure living create harmony with unseen realms.

title: Yun Se-Pyong, the Wizard
author: Im Bang
summary: Yun Se-Pyong is a legendary wizard in Korean lore, respected for his magical talents and his role among the three great spirit-men of Chosun. His life and feats demonstrate the influence of mystics in Korean history.

title: The Wild-Cat Woman
author: Im Bang
summary: A tale of a mysterious woman who transforms into a wild-cat, representing the dangers of the supernatural and the necessity for courage and wisdom.

title: The Ill-Fated Priest
author: Im Bang
summary: A priest's tragic fate is sealed by his inability to overcome supernatural forces and misfortune, illustrating how fate and omens shape human lives in Korean tradition.

title: The Vision of the Holy Man
author: Im Bang
summary: A holy man is granted divine visions and prophecies, leading communities through spiritual wisdom. The story extols the virtue and role of spiritual guides in maintaining harmony with the unseen world.
file: The Vision of the Holy Man.txt

title: The Visit of the Man of God
author: Im Bang
summary: The arrival of a mysterious man of God brings blessings and revelations to those who welcome him, demonstrating respect for the supernatural and hospitality toward strangers.
file: The Visit of the Man of God.txt

title: The Literary Man of Imsil
author: Im Bang
summary: A scholar of Imsil displays remarkable wit and literary prowess while encountering the supernatural, illustrating how cleverness and artistry bring success and protection.

title: The Soldier of Kang-Wha
author: Im Bang
summary: A soldier stationed at Kang-Wha faces trial by supernatural forces and emerges victorious through discipline and courage.

title: Cursed by the Snake
author: Im Bang
summary: A chilling narrative of a man cursed by a snake he mistreated, causing harm to his family and a lesson of karma and respect for animals.

title: The Man on the Road
author: Im Bang
summary: A wandering traveler encounters a sequence of mystical and threatening events on an isolated road—an allegory for vigilance and faith on life’s journey.

title: The Old Man Who Became a Fish
author: Im Bang
summary: A cautionary tale about an old man transformed into a fish as punishment or result of supernatural interference, reflecting on change and humility.
file: The Old Man Who Became a Fish.txt

title: The Geomancer
author: Im Bang
summary: The mysterious and powerful skills of a geomancer affect his life and those of others through the art of divining propitious sites and events.

title: The Man Who Became a Pig
author: Im Bang
summary: A humorous but cautionary tale about a man transformed into a pig due to folly or magical intervention, showing the consequences of vice.
file: The Man Who Became a Pig.txt

title: The Old Woman Who Became a Goblin
author: Im Bang
summary: A tale of an old woman transformed into a goblin, warning of the dangers that come with greed or disrespect toward mystical powers.
file: The Old Woman Who Became a Goblin.txt

title: The Grateful Ghost
author: Im Bang
summary: A grateful spirit helps those who honor the dead, reflecting on respect for ancestors and the unseen aid that virtuous deeds attract.

title: The Plucky Maiden
author: Im Bang
summary: A courageous young woman faces supernatural threats with wit and bravery, embodying the empowerment of women in Korean tradition.

title: The Resourceful Wife
author: Im Bang
summary: A wife’s cleverness and fortitude save her family during supernatural trials, showing the vital role of women’s resourcefulness in folk tales.

title: The Boxed-Up Governor
author: Im Bang
summary: A corrupt official receives poetic justice when tricked and boxed up by the clever commoners he oppressed.

title: The Man Who Lost His Legs
author: Im Bang
summary: A story of a man whose legs are mysteriously lost as a result of supernatural influence or as punishment, reflecting the unpredictable nature of fate in folk beliefs.
file: The Man Who Lost His Legs.txt

title: Ten Thousand Devils
author: Im Bang
summary: An allegory about a confrontation with a legion of devils, focusing on themes of courage, temptation, and the resilience of the human spirit in the face of evil.

title: The Home of the Fairies
author: Im Bang
summary: A mortal stumbles upon the hidden abode of fairies, exploring the boundaries between human and supernatural worlds and the price of forbidden knowledge.

title: The Honest Witch
author: Im Bang
summary: A rare tale of a witch who uses her powers for good, offering wisdom and help rather than harm, thus subverting expectations of witchcraft in traditional stories.

title: Whom the King Honors
author: Im Bang
summary: A parable centered on loyalty to the king and the rewards bestowed by authority on the virtuous and faithful.

title: The Fortunes of Yoo
author: Im Bang
summary: The ups and downs of Yoo, a man whose destiny is shaped by supernatural forces, luck, and perseverance.

title: An Encounter with a Hobgoblin
author: Im Bang
summary: A man unwittingly meets a mischievous hobgoblin, leading to chaos and lessons in humility, luck, and cleverness.

title: The Snake’s Revenge
author: Im Bang
summary: A vengeful snake takes retribution on a household, warning of the consequences of cruelty to animals.

title: The Brave Magistrate
author: Im Bang
summary: A magistrate confronts supernatural threats with courage and wisdom, restoring balance and justice to his district.

title: The Temple to the God of War
author: Im Bang
summary: The founding of a temple honoring the god of war, describing miracles, rituals, and the martial spirit in Korean tradition.
file: The Temple to the God of War.txt

title: A Visit from the Shades
author: Im Bang
summary: A mortal receives a visit from the spirits of the dead, resulting in revelations or warnings for the living.

title: The Fearless Captain
author: Im Bang
summary: A courageous captain overcomes supernatural adversaries, embodying leadership, valor, and the power of belief.

title: The King of Yom-na (Hell)
author: Im Bang
summary: This tale explores the Buddhist folklore and moral judgments delivered by the king of the underworld, addressing justice after death.

title: Hong’s Experiences in Hades
author: Im Bang
summary: Hong narrates his journey through the horrors and lessons of the Korean underworld after death, describing punishments and the hope for redemption.

title: Haunted Houses
author: Im Bang
summary: A recounting of multiple haunted dwellings, each with its own ghostly backstory and supernatural events.

title: Im, the Hunter
author: Im Bang
summary: Im, a skilled hunter, faces supernatural dangers in the wild, showcasing courage, perseverance, and respect for the natural and spiritual world.

title: The Magic Invasion of Seoul
author: Im Bang
summary: A tale of magical chaos and heroism as Seoul faces a supernatural invasion, requiring wit and magical prowess to repel the threat.

title: The Awful Little Goblin
author: Im Bang
summary: A troublesome goblin causes chaos until clever humans find a way to outwit him, teaching lessons about cunning and problem-solving.

title: God’s Way
author: Im Bang
summary: A philosophical narrative about the mysterious workings of heaven and fate, challenging human understanding of the divine.

title: The Old Man in the Dream
author: Im Bang
summary: A dream encounter with an aged spirit conveys advice or prophecy, blending the worlds of the living and the spiritual.
file: The Old Man in the Dream.txt

title: The Perfect Priest
author: Im Bang
summary: A priest achieves spiritual enlightenment and utters profound teachings, inspiring all who follow his example.

title: The Propitious Magpie
author: Im Bang
summary: The appearance of a magpie brings fortune and symbolically guides characters through pivotal moments, celebrating omens in Korean tradition.

title: The ‘Old Buddha’
author: Im Bang
summary: A tale centered on the veneration of an old Buddha statue and its miraculous influence in the human realm.

title: A Wonderful Medicine
author: Im Bang
summary: A miraculous cure appears under mysterious circumstances, blending folk medicine and supernatural assistance.

title: Faithful Mo
author: Im Bang
summary: Mo’s unwavering loyalty to family and friends is tested by supernatural events, serving as a model of perseverance and virtue.

title: The Renowned Maing
author: Im Bang
summary: Maing’s exploits and renown stem from a blend of human ingenuity and supernatural favor.

title: The Senses
author: Im Bang
summary: A philosophical reflection on the five senses, using parables to teach wisdom and self-discipline.

title: Who Decides, God or the King?
author: Im Bang
summary: A tale debating the source of real authority: divine power or royal command, using allegorical trials.
file: Who Decides, God or the King.txt

title: Three Things Mastered
author: Im Bang
summary: A wise person gains mastery over three important aspects of life, offering instructions for self-betterment and success.

title: Strangely Stricken Dead
author: Im Bang
summary: A mysterious death occurs with supernatural undertones, highlighting the dangers of ignoring omens.

title: The Mysterious Hoi Tree
author: Im Bang
summary: The enigmatic hoi tree becomes a focal point for supernatural happenings, revealing the spiritual side of nature.

title: Ta-Hong
author: Im Bang
summary: The legend of Ta-Hong, a character whose adventures blend heroism and supernatural interventions.
